data.text:
2023-24 Men's Basketball Roster

Choose a Player:

Courtney Bay / Illinois Athletics

Class Graduate Student

Height 6-6

Weight 215

Hometown Waupun, Wis.

High School Waupun

Prev School Southern Illinois

Instagram marcusdomask

Twitter marcusdomask

Bio

Related

Stats

Biography

NIL Opportunities

Domask's Career & Season Game-By-Game Stats (PDF)

2023-24 Grad Student

First-team All-Big Ten (coaches, AP), second-team (media), and AP Big Ten Newcomer of the Year

CSC Academic All-District

38 starts, ranking second on the team in scoring (15.9 ppg), first in assists (3.9 apg), and fourth in rebounding (5.0 rpg)

Shot 87.2% (130-149) from the free-throw line, the third-highest mark in program history (min. 75 attempts)

Ranked second on the team with four double-doubles

Scored in double figures in 29 of final 38 games, including 28 of the final 32 contests

Team-high 17 points with 3 rebounds, 1 assist and 2 steals in Elite 8 vs. #1 Connecticut (3/30)

7 points, 6 rebounds, and team-high 5 assists in Illinois' Sweet 16 win against #4 Iowa State (3/28)

22 points, game-high 7 assists, three rebounds and a season-high two steals in NCAA Rd. 2 vs. Duquesne (3/23)

First-career triple double (12 points, 11 rebounds, 10 assists), sixth in Illinois history, first by an Illini in the NCAA tournament, and the 10th overall in NCAA Tournament history vs. Morehead State (3/21)

26 points (8-11 FGs, 9-10 FTs) with game-highs in rebounds (7) and assists (8) for BTT title vs. Wisconsin (3/17)

16 points, 7 rebounds, and a team-high 8 assists with 1 steal in BTT semifinal win vs. Nebraska (3/16)

Team-high 20 points, his ninth game with 20+, and added four rebounds and four assists vs. #3 Purdue (3/5)

31 points with a season-high four 3FG, plus eight rebounds, and three assists in win at Wisconsin (3/2)

22 points and team highs with 7 rebounds and 5 assists vs. Minnesota. (2/28)

15 points, 3 rebounds and a team-high six assists at Penn State (2/21)

Eclipsed 2,000 career points in double-double effort of 19 points and a game-high 12 rebounds at Maryland (2/17)

12 points (5-9 FGs) and added 2 rebound and 3 assists vs. Michigan (2/13)

Tied season highs in 3-pointers (3) and blocks (2) and finished with 12 points at Michigan State (2/10)

19 points and 5 assists in home win vs. Nebraska (2/4)

Tied for team lead with 23 points, in road win at Ohio State (1/30)

Second double-double of the season with 16 points and 10 rebounds, plus four assists vs. Indiana (1/27)

Tied for team-high with 22 points (9-18 FGs, 2-4 3FGs) at Northwestern (1/24)

12 points, 7 rebounds and 5 assists in Illini’s home win over Rutgers (1/21)

15 points, 3 rebounds, 1 block and 1 steal at Michigan (1/18)

Team-high 26 points and 4 rebounds vs. Maryland (1/24)

15 points (6-6 FTs), six rebounds, and a game-high 5 assists vs. Michigan State (1/11)

Named B1G and AP Player of the Week, and 1 of 5 USBWA Oscar Robertson Players of the Week, after averaging 29.5 points, 5.5 assists and 4.0 rebounds vs. Northwestern and at #1 Purdue

Game-high 26 points, including 9-10 FTs, plus 5 assist and 1 steal at #1 Purdue (1/5) Game-high 32 points (11-15 FGs) with 5 rebounds, 6 assists and 1 block vs. Northwestern (1/2)

First double-double as an Illini with 11 points and a career-high 11 assists vs. FDU (12/29)

10 points, 7 rebounds and a season-high 7 assists vs. Missouri (12/22)

11 points, including a season-best 6-6 FTs, vs. Colgate (12/17)

Career-high 33 points on 15-for-21 (.714) shooting, plus 3 assists in win vs. #11 Florida Atlantic (12/5) at Madison Square Garden

15 points (6-13 FG), 7 rebounds, with 2 assists and 1 block at Rutgers (12/2)

Led all players with a season-high nine rebounds vs. Southern (11/19)

First double-figures scoring game as an Illini with 18 points, including 3 3-pointers, and 6 rebounds vs. #4 Marquette (11/14)

Tied for team lead with 3 assists in a game-high 29 minutes in Illinois debut vs. EIU (11/6)

Career at SIU

Returning for “super senior” season via the COVID-19 additional year of competition opportunity

Prior to transferring to Illinois, played four years at Southern Illinois where he was a three-time All-Missouri Valley Conference selection and posted career averages of 15.2 points, 5.3 rebounds and 3.4 assists in 35.1 minutes over 106 career games

Ranks in the SIU top 10 in five career categories: ninth in scoring with 1,615 points, sixth in free throw shooting at 84.3%, eighth with 332 free throws, eighth with 165 three-pointers, and eighth with 356 assists

Just the second player in Saluki history to score 1,600 points and have 500 rebounds and 300 assists

2022-23 Senior (at SIU)

First-team All-MVC

MVC Scholar-Athlete of the Year

Started every game and led SIU in scoring (16.7 ppg), rebounding (5.8 rpg), assists (3.8 apg), free throw percentage (.876), and minutes (35.4 mpg)

Ranked fifth in MVC in scoring

Scored in double-figures in 28 of 33 games, with 10 performances of 20-plus points

Set career high in scoring twice, with 32 points vs. California Baptist (11/23/22) and at Illinois State behind career high six 3-pointers (1/29/23)

Double-double at Murray State with 20 points and season-high 11 rebounds (12/29/22)

31 points on 13-of-18 FG vs. Evansville (1/17/23)

24 points with career-high tying six treys vs. Northern Iowa (2/22/23)

Season-high seven assists on four occasions

MVC Player of the Week (11/28/22)

2021-22 Junior (at SIU)

Second-team All-MVC

MVC Scholar-Athlete of the Year

Started every game and led the team in scoring (15.1 ppg), rebounding (5.2 rpg) and assists (3.9 apg)

Third player in school history to lead the Salukis in points, rebounds, and assists on the season

Double-figure scorer in 23 games with nine outings of 20+, including four-straight 20-point games from 12/28/21-1/15/22

Season-high 25 points vs. Bradley (2/15/22)

Made 32 straight free throws during a nine-game stretch (11/22/21-12/28/21), the second-longest streak in SIU history

Hit the game-winning basket with one second remaining at Evansville (12/1/21)

Grabbed career-high 13 rebounds at Loyola Chicago (1/25/22)

Had a streak of 133-consecutive minutes played without committing a turnover, from 1/25/22-2/5/22

Tallied 1,000th career point at Indiana State (2/19/22)

Dished out career-high nine assists vs. Illinois State (2/23/22)

2020-21 Sophomore (at SIU)

MVC Commissioner's Academic Excellence Award

Started the first 10 games before missing the rest of the season with an injury

Averaged 16.3 points, 4.5 rebounds and 3.2 assists

Two-time MVC Player of the Week

Season-high 26 points in win at Butler, snapping Bulldogs’ 59-game nonconference winning streak at Hinkle Fieldhouse (12/21/20)

25 points and season-high seven assists against Evansville (12/28/20)

2019-20 Freshman (at SIU)

Freshman All-American by College Insider

MVC Newcomer of the Year and Freshman of the Year

NABC All-District Second Team

MVC All-Newcomer Team and All-Freshman Team

Three-time MVC Newcomer of the Week

Started every game, averaging 13.6 points, 5.2 rebounds and 2.5 assists

Led MVC freshmen in scoring and assists, and ranked second in rebounding and third in steals

Season-high 28 points at Drake (2/1/20), the most points by an MVC freshman in a league play since 2014

Scored in double figures 22 times, with five 20-point games

Double-double with 18 points and season-high 12 rebounds vs. Norfolk State (12/4/19)

High School

2019 Wisconsin Mr. Basketball by the Wisconsin Basketball Coaches Association

Led Waupun to a state runner-up finish as a senior and the school's first-ever state title as a freshman, earning Gatorade Player of the Game in 2016 state championship game

Averaged 26.1 points, 10.0 rebounds, and 5.7 assists as a senior

Scored 2,307 career points

Personal

Born June 9, 2000

Enrolled in the UI master’s program in recreation, sport, and tourism

Earned a bachelor’s degree from Southern Illinois in sport administration

Parents are Dan and Patti Domask

Has two older sisters, Morgan and Maiah, and an older brother, Mason

Maiah played college basketball at Wisconsin-Platteville, and Mason played at Winona State

Hobbies include watching Netflix, listening to music, and reading Christian books to grow his faith

Proudest basketball achievement is winning a state championship as a freshman at Waupun

Favorite athlete is Giannis Antetokounmpo

Favorite teams are the Milwaukee Bucks and Green Bay Packers

Credits his father and brother for most influencing his basketball career, “My dad taught me the game and coached me. And my brother brought me to the gym, and I tried to emulate him.”

Chose Illinois because “the coaching staff showed they believe in me, and the winning tradition is big here, people care a lot about basketball.”
